news.title: UK is closing loophole that grants cheap windfalls to Irish pension savers
news.summary: The UK is shutting a lucrative loophole that enabled Irish people who once worked there to cheaply boost their British state pension entitlements by thousands of euro a year.

news.title: Emily Hourican: Passionate, brave and outspoken, Hugh Wallace talked about emotion as candidly as he did about architecture
news.summary: I first met Hugh Wallace at the opening of a new hotel. I can’t remember which one. It was the early 2000s – there were new hotel (and bar and restaurant) openings every week, it seemed.

news.title: Regulator wants RTÉ and TG4 to get more money from taxpayers
news.summary: Coimisiún na Meán has recommended that both RTÉ and TG4 be given millions of euro extra to help them meet their public service obligations.

news.title: Colm Keys: New image rights deal has opened financial doors of opportunity for GPA and players
news.summary: The issue of the image rights of inter-county GAA players has washed up on the GAA’s shores consistently in the two-and-a-half decades since the Gaelic Players Association (GPA) was born.

news.title: ‘Mam transferred the farm to me but her health has deteriorated and my siblings won’t help out. Am I liable for her care? What are my options?’
news.summary: Query:  Dear Mary Frances, I don’t know where to turn. Two years ago, I inherited the family farm from my mother, who was in good health at the time.

news.title: The Indo Daily: NIMBY or necessary? The South Dublin residents delaying MetroLink mega-project
news.summary: The underground rail line, first floated in 2001, has hit yet another obstacle. Residents of Dartmouth Square fear the construction of the Charlemont terminus could damage their 19th-century homes.

news.title: How to financially prepare for a breakup, according to money experts
news.summary: Walking away from a relationship is rarely straightforward. But for those in marriages and long-term relationships, there is much more to consider than just taking a bag of stuff and waving goodbye.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s restaurant review: Like many things that are overhyped, Gloria Osteria’s ‘incomparable lemon pie’ tastes like styrofoam
news.summary: Every so often a new restaurant lands in our fair city and it’s treated like the arrival of the messiah. Of course I get the invitations to participate, but do I really want a ‘hard hat’ tour of the fit-out?

news.title: New plan to fight back against ‘weaponising’ of objections to infrastructure projects
news.summary: New proposals will come before the Cabinet today to limit objections to major projects, so that the breaking of ground can go ahead promptly.
